name: Asparagus, Chicken, and Pecan Pasta
author: Julie Ledford
summary: Penne pasta tossed with asparagus, red peppers, pecans, and Parmesan cheese in a delicious sauce that is creamy without being over-powering. This has been a tremendous hit every time I've made it.
ingredients: 2 bunches asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1 inch pieces
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add penne pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes; drain
Heat the olive oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over medium heat
Stir in the garlic, red pepper, and asparagus; cook and stir 5 minutes until the garlic softens and mellows
Pour in the chicken broth, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat
Simmer until the vegetables have softened, then add the basil, salt, pepper, butter, and chicken
Cook and stir a few minutes until the chicken is hot
Stir in the cooked pasta, then fold in the Parmesan cheese and pecan halves to serve
